examples: Please excuse me for arriving late - the bus was delayed.

definitions.definition: a polite way of attracting someone's attention, especially of someone you do not know:
examples: Excuse me, does this bus go to Oxford Street?

definitions.definition: used to politely ask someone to move so that you can walk past them:
examples: Excuse me, can I just get past?

definitions.definition: used to tell someone politely that you are leaving:
examples: Excuse me a moment, I'll be with you shortly.

definitions.definition: used to say sorry for something you have done by accident:
examples: Did I take your seat? Do excuse me.
Excuse me but aren't you forgetting something?

definitions.definition: used to politely ask someone to repeat something they have said because you have not heard it
a reason that you give to explain why you did something wrong:
examples: He'd better have a good excuse for being late.

definitions.definition: a false reason that you give to explain why you do something:
examples: [ + to infinitive ] She was just looking for an excuse to call him.

definitions.definition: to explain why you cannot be present somewhere:
examples: Please make my excuses at the meeting on Friday.

definitions.definition: to give false reasons why you cannot do something:
examples: You're always making excuses for not helping me.
